metadata.title: CVE-2023-6200 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the Linux Kernel. Under certain conditions,an unauthenticated attacker from an adjacent network could send an ICMPv6router advertisement packet, causing arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-aws package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.7').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
